climbs.name: Two Scary
climbs.fa: Josh Fraiser, Sam Schmetzer, Aaron Lawrence

content.description: fun short climb, crux is getting to 2nd bolt
content.protection: 2 bolts, chain anchor shared with "Brown Trout Boogie"

climbs.name: Storm
climbs.fa: Aaron Lawrence, Sam Schmetzer, Josh Fraiser

content.description: maybe the best climb at the crag. the arete. this climb has a bit of everything,start up a crack, to slab, to awesome roof, to face, finish over a thin bulge to mantle a ledge where the anchors at your waist. crux is passing the roof, this move will be a tough onsight, you may get frustrated. once you figure it out, its 10a/b.
content.protection: 5 bolts, use a long draw on 2nd bolt. (3rd and 4th bolts have perma-draws). sport anchors.
content.location: 5th route from left. the arete. between "Mosquito" and "Cat Scratch Fever"

climbs.name: Mosquito
climbs.fa: Aaron Lawrence, Sam Schmetzer, Josh Fraiser

content.description: super fun climb.1st crux is passing the roof, dont get into the crack on the left, stay on the face. shorter climbers may have trouble on this one. 2nd crux is the finishing move after last bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts. use a long draw on 2nd bolt, helps with rope drag. sport anchors.
content.location: 4th climb from left, just right of "Crack Route"

climbs.name: After Shock
climbs.fa: Sam Schmetzer, Aaron Lawrence, Josh Fraiser

content.description: fun climbing right of the arete, crux at the top, between last bolt and anchor

Climb the easy moves (clipping the first bolt) to a ledge here you'll start up a small, right facing dihedral using the crack or the face holds.  Protect this section with gear.  Once above the dihedral clip the second bolt and make the final moves to the anchor.
content.location: This route is obvious and is currently the only bolted route on the face.  Right up the middle.

content.protection: 3 bolts, chain anchor shared with "Two Scary"
